title: How to change email spacing to single space from double space
content:
My email messaging seems to be set at a defined format with double spacing. I prefer to use single spacing but in order to do this I have to type all the way to the end of the page and then it will automatically go to the next paragraph and will then use single spacing. I would really like to be able to format my emails with single spacing and different margins other than what I have to use now (i.e.using the entire width of the message). I cannot find any way to change this automatic double spacing and change the width of the paragraph at the same time. From the drop down list directly above the body of the message, I have tried changing from Body Text to Paragraph and back again, but nothing works. Thanks very much for your help.

P. S. I am using Windows 10 with Thunderbird version 128.4.2 esr. I had the same problem in more recent versions but not in older versions.
creator: c.evansandrews

title: Unable to send Optus emails
content: I am unable to send emails from my Optusnet email account through Thunderbird. This also happened a couple of weeks ago, and was resolved with Optus Tech support by updating the SMTP settings, but they don't seem to be able to help this time. What settings do you recommend? Or other solution?
creator: cnesbitthawes

title: Thunderbird tries to redownload emails after transferring profile from Windows machine to Linux machine
content:
I followed Mozilla's official instructions for transferring and Thunderbird profile to a new device (running Fedora 40 and Thunderbird version 115). Thunderbird seemed to read my profiles folder correctly, as all my accounts and RSS feeds were present after I copied the old profile to folder to my new .thunderbird directory. However, after downloading the header files for the emails I have received since switching computers, it then tries to download all 60,000 emails or so on my gmail account even though most of these emails should be included in the profile folder already - it looks like have 6 GB INBOX file within this profile.

Is there a way to get thunderbird to read the profile without redownloading all the messages from my accounts? I unfortunately no longer have access to my old windows machine that this profile is from, just the profile folder itself. Let me know if there is anything I can do!
creator: utheriwagura

All my emails was not found in the new pc. Basically, I have a lot of email (~170GB) were located on different folders of the old pc. I have copied the thunderbird profiles folder under the roaming folder, and copy various email folders to the new pc with same locations ( such as under D:\data\... How can I get back all old emails with the same hierarchy structure?
creator: kenny23

title: Unable to send or receive emails.
content:
For the last three days I've been unable to receive or send emails from Thunderbird. The following messages are being generated:

1.Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) timed out. Try again.

2. Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.telstra.com failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again.

I've confirmed the settings with the ISP (Telstra) and the Telstra webmail works so they say everything is OK at their end.

I've turned off Malwarebytes, AVG, and PrivateVPN and closed and restarted Thunderbird and still no success. I've read multitudes of info on the internet and tried all sorts of different things to no avail. The only success I've had is to connect the laptop to my phone and use the phones data through the wifi phone network. Thunderbird then receives and sends emails. However this is not a sustainable solution.

Any assistance would be appreciated.

NDLJ
creator: joesuen

title: Plugin installálás
content: Sziasztok! Kiegészítő telepítésével van gondom. Például szeretnék új témát telepíteni de miután letöltöttem a témát, majd kiválasztom a fájlból telepítést a Hozzáadás gombra kattintva az csatolt ablak "kifagy", cserébe nem települ a téma. De ugyanez a helyzet más kiegészítők telepítésénél is. Korábban sikerült néhány kiegészítőt telepítenem úgy, hogy a letöltött plugin jogosultságát átállítottam futtathatóra, de ez sehogy nem működik már. Segítségteket előre is köszönöm! joe
creator: girntjoe

Merci

title: Sticky icons on Linux Panel
content:
I'm a proud user of Mozilla Thunderbird since... ages, actually. The last updates sets an incredible step forward from older versions and I'm obsessed with 128.4 Everything works fine and smoothly. I'm not looking back to any other mail software ever.

BUT

I'm running Linux Mint 21.3 and the past weeks I've noticed the active Thunderbird icons on my panel while Thunderbird is open changes depending on the window currently in use, or the active task: a pen when you're writing an email, a bell while you're managing your calendar stuff, etc. That's great. Surprisingly that new icon stays on the panel, although I close that window or end the task involved. To see the Thunderbird icon I have to completely exit the program and re open it. It's only a visual issue but it's itching my nerves.

Any suggestions?

Thanks in advance
creator: cesarbrito50

title: Do "smart" mailing lists exist in Thunderbird?
content:
Dear community, 25 years ago i was using a macbook. The mail app had this feature: I could use whatever keyword from the contacts in my address book (f.e. people in the same company, or the same region, or everyone that i had added a word like "friend", "business", "sailing" etc) to create a "smart group". I find this very convenient and since then i always add some keywords to my contacts. I migrated to Linux some years ago and i am missing this feature again and again. Is there any way to configure a mailing list according to contact-content instead of doing it manually? If not, is there any email client that could do that?

Thanks!
creator: andreas194
